page.title: 12WAR MEMORIAL
page.content: The War Memorial had its inception in 1919. The present building was raised by subscription and in 1925 the present building was erected. Because so much money was raised an{Art {Gallery}was added on to the building. The entrance to the Memorial Hall is supported by two Cippolino (Greek) marble columns. The walls are faced with a soft brownish-yellow Botticino Mazzano (Italian) Marble. The names of the fallen are engraved in White Italian Marble. Over the door on the left, as one enters, there is the inscription "There Name Liveth For Evermore". On the facing wall there is an extract from the Kings Scroll which was sent to the relatives of every fallen man during the Great War. In 1952 three more tablets were added to bear the names of those who died in World War II.
